pr_body:
Fixes #19196

This immediately shows the menu for which messages to move when
the user can not edit the content of the message.
I also changed the visibility so that the menu stays visible once it was shown once, to avoid it getting shown and removed all the time, which would confuse the user.

How it looks when the message is not editable:
![chrome-capture-2022-5-23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/175246345-a3484b6e-fd28-43c2-97e1-e9f0f13ed50f.gif)

How it looks when the message is editable:
![chrome-capture-2022-5-23 (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/175246414-634e09b5-75aa-43d8-8648-646f3df6ae8a.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 920498021, 'comment_body': "Can you explain this line? It seems to me that in situations where both the content and the topic are editable, that we'd incorrectly not display the menu.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 13, 20, 48, 30, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 921186695, 'comment_body': '@timabbott you are right, if the content is editable, the menu is not immediately displayed. But this is the expected behavior, since the main goal of editing a message, when the content is still editable, is expected to be editing the content. And because of this it would be confusing to immediately show the menu then, as the user might not know what this refers to.
(See also my previous messages with @alya or the issue description)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 14, 13, 57, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 921820153, 'comment_body': 'Could you please add a code comment before this line explaining it? Thanks!', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 5, 19, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'alya', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922104297, 'comment_body': '@alya alright, added the comment', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 12, 8, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922556184, 'comment_body': 'So I'm glad we spent some extra attention on this line, because it's wrong in the case that the user can't edit the message at all (aka "View source"):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2746074/179319205-5d964d85-033d-4fc3-9f53-6769f5e0150f.png)

I'll fix this before merging, since I think the fix is straightforward.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 22, 32, 10, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
This rewords the move message dropdown menu.
![tmp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/179277404-80e29a2c-78a6-4e39-a1c1-40e87f4ae17f.png)

I also updated the width off the dropdown menu a bit to account for the new wording, adapted the order of the options and updated the help pages.

This resolves the issue discussed in [#issues/move messages default section](https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/9-issues/topic/move.20messages.20default.20selection)

Changed the default move option from "Move only this message" to "Move this and all following messages in this topic".

Changed the stream settings UI so that the buttons use tooltips instead of titles.
![chrome-capture-2022-6-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/179405592-3e5ace7e-6af4-4fe4-acd5-a359c0eaa796.gif)

Separated out of #20536
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 928043817, 'comment_body': "What happens if we add this class but don't set `data-tippy-tooltip`? Seems like that happens if `!should_display_subscription_button`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 22, 23, 33, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 928099128, 'comment_body': '@timabbott when exactly is `should_display_subscription_button` set to false? Because i could recreate this..
But i tried it with removing `data-tippy-tooltip` completely while keeping `tippy-zulip-tooltip`, this works without any problems, because if data-tippy-tooltip is not set here, the button is disabled, so if the user hovers over it they just see the symbol for disabled buttons.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 23, 8, 56, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 929418275, 'comment_body': 'I think the main situation is if you're an administrator looking at a stream you're not subscribed to in "all streams".
```
static/js/stream_settings_data.js:    sub.should_display_subscription_button = stream_data.can_toggle_subscription(sub);
```


In any case, it seemed more correct to just add a second `if` statement around setting the tooltip property too, so I did that and merged this.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 26, 0, 15, 29, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: drafts: Fix cant delete on android bug.
pr_body:
Fixes #22512

This fixes the bug that a user was not able to delete drafts in mobile or narrow view.
The problem was that the message-content box overlapped with the drafts-controls.
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 941638706, 'comment_body': 'How is the 115px here calculated? Could it be better done as a `calc()` or using a variable shared with a related value in this file?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 9, 17, 52, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 945260599, 'comment_body': "i copied these values from how the padding was originally on formats where this bug didn't occur:
![tmp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/184531478-0536fa8f-4cda-498c-b701-9bebaa895a5a.png)

", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 14, 9, 47, 22, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: stream settings: Show stream header in narrow view.
pr_body:
This changes the streams overlay so that the header with the stream name or with 'Create stream' is also visible in a narrow window.

Resolves #22963

![tmp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/190433782-9dd6edce-7e9e-4e40-8237-fc65278fe7c7.png)

![tmp2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/190433788-a7f355a1-ff4f-47e9-b0ee-b04f2ef1b594.png)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 993992984, 'comment_body': "@m-e-l-u-h-a-n I'm not sure whether the `group_overlay` block here should be removed as well; can you test that and submit a quick PR if appropriate?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 13, 0, 0, 26, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Fixes #21712

Send a notification to the old and new topic after only the topic was changed, not the stream.
![chrome-capture-2022-5-30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/176680531-25afd740-c651-4c69-b34b-a3dd79bbd1e8.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 911058806, 'comment_body': 'Hmm, is there any reason to change this to 2 for `waiting_period_threshold`?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 30, 13, 55, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'refeed', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 911060386, 'comment_body': 'I think the name `is_topic_changed` is better for this variable since I thought `changed_topic` contained the name of the changed topic', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 30, 13, 56, 45, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'refeed', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 911162079, 'comment_body': "@refeed I don't know, that's why i asked about that in CZO, i had to change it to that, because otherwise the test doesn't pass, but i don't know why this is the case..", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 30, 15, 24, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 911162621, 'comment_body': "That's a good point, i will change that", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 30, 15, 25, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 911203330, 'comment_body': 'I see, sometimes the tests in gh actions are flaky too and needs to be restarted. I just tested it in my local env, it is actually this change that made the test fails. I think it is safe to revert all of the changes in this file', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 6, 30, 16, 0, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'refeed', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 916612740, 'comment_body': '@refeed okay, that really seemed to be the problem..
But the test failed a few days ago locally too, do you have an idea why this could be the case? (now it is working fine, maybe because i rebased or provisioned?)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 8, 8, 59, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 916669469, 'comment_body': 'Hmm, currently, I also have no idea too, rebasing to the latest master/provisioning could be the one that solved it. :D', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 8, 10, 5, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'refeed', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922561996, 'comment_body': "The intent here is to avoid sending both moved message and resolved topic notifications, right? I think a better approach would be to (1) reorder the checks so we do the resolved topic check first, (2) have `maybe_send_resolve_topic_notifications` return whether it moved anything, and (3) then check that value in this block, rather than reimplementing logic to check whether we'll send resolve topic notifications.

This would be best done as a series of individual small commits.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 15, 22, 46, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 949652098, 'comment_body': 'Two comments on the commit message for this first commit:
* The `"Fixes #21712 partially"` commit message would close the issue as fixed as soon as this is merged, because GitHub's regex is sloppy and just looks at whether the string "Fixes #[0-9]+" appears in the commit message. 
"Fixes part of ..." is a workaround, though I did a more careful wording.
* We should explain that this commit does change behavior; as described in my revised commit message, the behavior change is likely equally good / a bit better.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 18, 22, 29, 8, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
This changes the stream settings UI so that it matches the normal settings UI.

Resolves #19519

- All settings are always shown as a list or a dropdown
- The current setting is checked
- An admin can update the setting inline
- Everyone else can't change the settings, as the checkboxes are disabled
- Changed settings can be saved or discarded with the save/discard-widget (like in the normal settings)

As a normal user:

![tmp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412237-6b454f2c-feac-4b06-9b77-2a01e4a9fe72.png)

![tmp2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412252-6e89a63d-2593-432e-93a3-6e204f229f2c.png)

![tmp3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412260-73ef4a9a-d495-49e9-9a77-3cd87a790bf6.png)



As an admin:

![tmp4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412322-30927efb-d2ee-473e-98f7-80475bf9d032.png)

![tmp5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412330-3451f8cc-5bd7-4903-85f9-5cef36064d7b.png)

![tmp6](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412336-f636da21-bdb0-4653-ab05-93b1556e8bd2.png)

![chrome-capture-2022-9-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/196412357-92519376-12af-46f7-838b-fb36806baaa5.gif)

pr_title: [Draft] View scheduled messages in drafts tab
pr_body:
This adds a new tab to the drafts modal where scheduled messages can be viewed and edited.

Fixes: #20971
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 986267983, 'comment_body': "I'm curious why you changed

```
if (
        (user_settings.enter_sends && !ctrl_pressed) ||
        (!user_settings.enter_sends && ctrl_pressed)
    )
```

to 

```
if (user_settings.enter_sends)
```

does this work differently now?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 3, 21, 52, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 987430969, 'comment_body': "I think you don't need this anymore :)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 5, 0, 24, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 987436719, 'comment_body': "I think you copied this from the draft code, which is probably what I'd have done too! I am wondering if you need the count, since it seems like the frontend could calculate that from `scheduled_messages` pretty easily. 

Maybe there's a reason it's used for drafts? Looking around the codebase I can't actually find anywhere that endpoint is used, and I'm pretty sure drafts are only stored in localstorage and the endpoint isn't actually used anywhere! I looked around for `request: HttpRequest` and found a lot of examples of just returning one thing in the dictionary, so that seems fine!", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 5, 0, 40, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 987443357, 'comment_body': "Using the same structure here as drafts feels reasonable to me since they're essentially saved drafts (and saving it this way would make it easier to revert scheduled messages into drafts)! I do want to note that if you plan to use code that looks pretty much the same, you should make it as shared code that can be used for either purpose.

Though ALSO possibly we just save all draft and scheduled messages as the same? Like extra-sharing, where they use the same object and database table, with some extra field to show if it's scheduled.

I think it's reasonable to also have a  `sending_client` and `realm` for stored drafts. And if the draft is scheduled, then `scheduled_timestamp` would be non-null. Let me know what you think! Happy to discuss more if this is confusing. Probably would also be good to talk to Tim about this. The draft endpoint isn't being used anywhere (as far as I can tell) so we could probably easily morph it to this use case", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 5, 0, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 987444514, 'comment_body': "Because `last_edit_time` was a datetime and not a string, I'm guessing it would be better to store this as a datetime as well. Maybe the reason for this is to make it easier to query/sort by time :)", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 5, 1, 2, 40, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 987454450, 'comment_body': 'if you store this as a datetime, you can use `datetime_to_timestamp` here', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 10, 5, 1, 28, 33, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Live update the stream privacy icon.
pr_body:
This live updates the stream privacy icon in the general stream
settings after changing the privacy setting of the stream.

![chrome-capture (1)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/151655715-ebc46f62-68b7-4a21-b90f-a8530eff8a1a.gif)
pr_review_comments: [{'comment_id': 797906104, 'comment_body': 'This should not be called here as then the icon would be changed even if the server returns error. You can try it by changing a default stream to be private. This should be called in the relevant function in `stream_ui_updates.js` which is executed after receiving update event from the server.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 2, 18, 33, 51, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 815010354, 'comment_body': 'This is not required, since we initially render the icon in template.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 25, 18, 45, 34, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 847052186, 'comment_body': 'I think we can move this function to `stream_ui_updates.js` file.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 11, 8, 6, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 847149059, 'comment_body': 'We need to be more selective here to update only if the section opened is of the changed stream. If you change privacy in one window and keep another window open in the browser showing settings of different stream, the icon of that incorrect stream will be updated.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 4, 11, 9, 53, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 918660351, 'comment_body': 'We can return early here if the edit panel is not opened like we do for other similar update functions using `hash_util.is_editing_stream`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 12, 7, 53, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 918661084, 'comment_body': 'We can directly use `stream_settings_containers.get_edit_container` here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 12, 7, 54, 6, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Option to send email to user when they are deactivated
pr_body:
Resolves https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/18943

This pull request adds the option to send a email to users after deactivating them.

![chrome-capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/151515246-47bcee02-8c63-4f4e-b493-4f4d41c65e0e.gif)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/151515300-2fba16c2-714d-4160-b555-987189281cba.png)

Resolves https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/20302

Added the following format buttons:

- Inline code
- Quote
- Spoiler
- Code block
- Strikethrough
- Latex
![format-buttons](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/147888401-1f2fdcff-9cc9-48fa-bd83-140eb12ccf14.png)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 796940449, 'comment_body': 'Magic numbers like 11 make the code hard to read and modify; we should wherever possible do things like `spoiler_syntax_start.length`. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 1, 19, 45, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 796942870, 'comment_body': 'It would be very helpful for any complex blocks like this to have brief comments with with examples indicating the state that one is trying to capture.

', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 1, 19, 47, 55, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 796943807, 'comment_body': "Is `setSelectionRange` the right function to use for this sort of manipulation?  I worry that it won't work with `Ctrl+Z` correctly.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 1, 19, 48, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 799526500, 'comment_body': 'console log in comment by mistake, I guess.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 4, 14, 44, 28, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'amanagr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 799532752, 'comment_body': 'These lint changes should be in the first commit. Every commit should pass `./tools/lint` and `./tools/test-js-with-node --coverage`  independently.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 4, 14, 51, 21, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'amanagr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 799536061, 'comment_body': 'Isn't `"\n```"` just `spoiler_syntax_end`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 4, 14, 54, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'amanagr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 799539508, 'comment_body': 'I see `"```spoiler "` being used in a lot of places too, we can replace it with a variable.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 2, 4, 14, 58, 37, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'amanagr', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 799543972, 'comment_body': 'Oh! pr_body:
Use simplebar in drafts overlay
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/156240400-00564928-1994-4aca-bfe4-1062a8f9dfac.png)

- Used `height: 100%` as a workaround to remove native scrollbar
- Updated `drafts_scroll` to use `ui.get_scroll_element`
- Changed the checks if scrolling is necessary so it works with the `scroll_element`
- Updated the value for which it is scrolled up/down halfway (before it happened that it was scrolled down, even though the focused draft wasn't cut of but fully visible)
- Removed `clientHeight` since this is not supported in all browsers (for example Chrome)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 817112034, 'comment_body': 'Why is this changed from 55 to 0? Also, the comment still refers to 55.

(Same with the −4 to 0 below.)', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 20, 21, 52, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'andersk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 817114101, 'comment_body': 'Oh yeah, i forgot to update the comments
I changed this because with 55 it happened, that the focused draft was the second one that was visible (so the top one was fully visible and the next one, the focused draft, was also fully visible) but the scrolling was still triggered.
Same with -4 to 0', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 20, 25, 2, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 823170574, 'comment_body': "Can you explain this more clearly?  I don't understand the explanation at all.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 9, 23, 5, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 824603306, 'comment_body': "@timabbott 
So if the user scrolls up or down the drafts using the up/down keys, this is the behavior i would expect:
![chrome-capture (6)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/157852152-a0cb70b9-f74a-4162-9767-4ab6a78510b3.gif)
In this example i am scrolling up (using the up key) and the moment the next focused draft (in this case `bnm`) is not fully visible anymore it is scrolled up so that the focused draft is fully visible and in the middle of the modal (it is in the middle, i just couldn't capture the whole window).
-> This is the case if i use `< 0` in the condition

But with using `< 55` in the condition it sometimes happens that this is the behavior: 
![chrome-capture (7)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/157853025-6d31cb5f-d527-45c5-b5a6-d8544af838cf.gif)
Again i am scrolling up using the up key. 
And i would expect that it is scrolled up once i focus the `ghj` draft, since this is the first draft that is not fully visible anymore.
But as you can see this already happens when focusing the top `fgh` draft, even though this draft is completely visible.

(the same thing applies while scrolling down)

I hope this clears it up a bit!
", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 11, 10, 53, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1084755744, 'comment_body': 'Changes in a pull request should be [grouped logically](https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/contributing/commit-discipline.html). If this change from 55 to 0 is a logical part of switching to SimpleBar, you should explain why it’s required for this switch. If this is a separate unrelated change, then you should open it as a separate PR that _doesn’t do anything else_, and explain there why you believe it’s desirable.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 2, 2, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'andersk', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1085672518, 'comment_body': '@andersk i tested it out, and this is indeed only needed after switching to SimpleBar, so i can't really separate this out into another PR.
I don't really understand what you mean with "explain why it's required for this switch", since i already explained that those changes are needed so the behavior explained above doesn't occur.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 17, 40, 1, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_title: Add copy email address modal to stream settings
pr_body:
This adds a button in the general stream settings, which opens a modal
where the user can copy the streams emails address.
They can also modify the tags that are included in the address before
copying it.

![chrome-capture (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/151660984-b581ca28-e256-4d02-95a1-06f2daf62e24.gif)
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 816951625, 'comment_body': 'Any reasons to have this CSS for header and make it separate from our other modals?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 16, 44, 47, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 816962682, 'comment_body': "I think we can have `input-group` class and then we can remove the `padding-bottom` property for `.checkbox` added above. This change will also make spacing between checkboxes same as we have in other places in the UI. And if we do this change, we can also remove the `margin-top` css from `stream-email`.

Also, I don't think new-style class is unnecessary for each div here. We can instead have a top-level div with `new-style` class to have the required CSS values.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 16, 56, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 816969991, 'comment_body': 'This can be deduplicated.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 17, 5, 7, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 816970376, 'comment_body': 'Do we need to set the checkbox values here. I think we always have `show-sender` in the email shown here by default and not other values. So, we can just check the `show-sender` checkbox if we can confirm that only `show-sender` is present in the email shown here by default. ', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 1, 17, 5, 32, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 818068475, 'comment_body': 'I thought that the header looks a bit squished otherwise, but i removed it to keep it consistent', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 2, 20, 18, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 818889885, 'comment_body': "Yes, it's always just `show-sender`", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 3, 17, 25, 48, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 819495507, 'comment_body': 'I think we do not need `!important` here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 4, 11, 33, 59, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 819502440, 'comment_body': 'It would be better to use a better selector here by adding a common class to all inputs and then using `#copy_email_address_modal .{class}`.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 4, 11, 45, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 819507182, 'comment_body': 'This can be moved out of the if-else block.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 4, 11, 52, 56, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 819511351, 'comment_body': 'Ideally we can avoid duplication here too like we do for display settings.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 4, 11, 59, 39, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 819512022, 'comment_body': 'Do we want to hide the email address section only instead of disabling the button? @alya @timabbott thoughts?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 4, 12, 0, 43, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 823612949, 'comment_body': 'We already have `padding` and `font-size` properties defined for `stream-email` class in `subscriptions.css`. We can modify it there itself.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 10, 11, 17, 16, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 823614647, 'comment_body': 'We would need to tag these description strings for translation.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 10, 11, 19, 27, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'sahil839', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 945295342, 'comment_body': 'Maybe extract out this if else portion to a new function like `get_email_address_based_on_tag(tag_name, checked)`, passing it `e.target.id` and `$(e.target).is(":checked")`, for better readability. And then set the field to this function's return value.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 14, 14, 3, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'N-Shar-ma', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 945312518, 'comment_body': 'Not sure if this is a problem, but the CSS selector looks too general / not specific enough.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 14, 16, 20, 58, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'N-Shar-ma', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 945319662, 'comment_body': 'This might be fine -- one can only have one `dialog_widget` visible at a time.

@sahil839 @ganpa3 FYI -- do we have a cleaner way to do this?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 14, 17, 18, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 945320077, 'comment_body': 'I think we want to refactor this to have a function that accepts a set of the current flags, like `include_footer`, and returns an email address computed for those flags; then we can add tests for that function, and can do something much more robust/simply than this `.replace()` toggling logic.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 14, 17, 22, 41, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'timabbott', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 947813897, 'comment_body': '@juliaBichler01 You can use the `id` of the modal to be more specific here
```
#copy_email_address_modal .dialog_submit_button
```', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 17, 11, 29, 4, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'ganpa3', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 950246117, 'comment_body': '@timabbott okay, i added this function and also a test for it', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 8, 19, 14, 24, 5, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}]

pr_body:
Resolves zulip/zulip#19360

A added the possibility to bulk-delete drafts (instead of having to delete each one individually):
![bulk-delete_all](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/140652397-0bda523c-a906-4e2e-bfde-ea04de3b34c2.gif)

It is also possible to mark the drafts individually or to unselect all drafts:
![bulk-delete_markManually](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/140652465-f6a0f256-e5ce-4fad-9322-f935c1d53b03.gif)

And you can unselect specifc drafts so you can delete all except those drafts:
![bulk-delete_notAll](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/74348920/140652552-6a6c2aa2-e782-41ab-9a9c-98229edb4791.gif)

Testing:
Manually, might need some formal tests in frontend_tests/node_tests or frontend_tests/puppeteer_tests
pr_review_comments:
[{'comment_id': 825041916, 'comment_body': 'I think we are setting a lot of style properties as hard calculated values here as well as in next commit. I think it should be possible to avoid this if we properly refactor [static/templates/draft_table_body.hbs](https://github.com/zulip/zulip/blob/main/static/templates/draft_table_body.hbs) and use flex box CSS properties efficiently.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 11, 19, 56, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'm-e-l-u-h-a-n', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 825046335, 'comment_body': "`id` attribute here would be same for every draft which it shouldn't be ideally. I guess this is not required as `#mark-draft` could easily be replaced with its class selector `.mark-draft`.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 11, 20, 2, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'm-e-l-u-h-a-n', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 825061814, 'comment_body': 'I think we are setting a lot of values position related values for `.delete-drafts-button` and `.select-drafts-button` in a hard coded manner by using `position: absolute`.  Which is probably the reason for position of select all drafts button to be unstable.

A more stable way to fix this could be to have drafts-header and drafts in two separate containers (divs) so that scrollbar only appears for drafts list and not for drafts header. Similar to what we do in other stream/organization settings modals.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 3, 11, 20, 17, 24, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'm-e-l-u-h-a-n', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 922846003, 'comment_body': 'i changed that, now this is a flex box as you reccomended', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2022, 7, 17, 14, 55, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067491674, 'comment_body': "The changes in this file seem like they were accidentally added to this commit! I'm guessing they're from a merge conflict where the wrong (old code-base) code was picked.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 21, 51, 11, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067493563, 'comment_body': 'These two lines are duplicated below, so you can delete one of them. Since you only use it once, I think you can also do `$(".mark-draft").filter = noop;`', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 21, 53, 50, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067494728, 'comment_body': "Can you make the flexbox changes in  commit that comes before this one, so that you don't have to write this code in this commit?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 21, 55, 20, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067497369, 'comment_body': "Why did you use `!important` here? Usually it's better to not use that and find another way to get the styles as you want them.", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 21, 58, 53, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067498178, 'comment_body': 'Things with ids should be expected to only appear on the DOM once. Here you can remove the id and just have the `mark-draft` classname.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 22, 0, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1067499444, 'comment_body': 'It would also be great if this could be handled by flexbox or something similar, instead of manual pixel adjustments here.', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 11, 22, 1, 54, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1083940820, 'comment_body': "i don't really know why, but for some reason i need both", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 23, 11, 29, 12, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1083978545, 'comment_body': 'back when i wrote this, this was needed for some reason
but now it also works without it, so i removed it', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 23, 12, 9, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1083984092, 'comment_body': 'this has to be changed after #21280 get merged anyway, so in my opinion changing this so it uses flexbox seems like a lot of unnecessary work, when it will have to be changed anyway
@alya what do you think?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 23, 12, 15, 9, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1085959587, 'comment_body': "Can you explain more about how it will need to be changed? I'd ideally review this PR without it having the manual pixel adjustments, but maybe that means building it over that other PR?", 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 21, 33, 17, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1085960943, 'comment_body': 'Can you remove this protip?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 21, 34, 3, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1085964230, 'comment_body': 'Ah great this is after flexbox now! Is there a way you can do this with flexbox instead of setting the pixels manually?', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 24, 21, 38, 18, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'evykassirer', 'type': 'User'}, {'comment_id': 1086909819, 'comment_body': '@evykassirer okay, i removed this line', 'comment_created': datetime.datetime(2023, 1, 25, 16, 59, 46, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc), 'commenter': 'juliaBichler01', 'type': 'User'}]
